definition[0]: written records of the financial accounts of a business
example[0]: An accountant will examine the company’s books.
example[1]: a small firm that is having problems balancing the books (=keeping its profits and spending equal)
example[2]: They have £50 billion worth of orders on the books.
definition[1]: the names of people who use a company’s services, or who are sent by a company to work for other people
example[3]: an agent with a lot of popular actors on his books
